page.title: 07 FARMING - MACE FARM
page.content: {Mace Farm}is situated about 1 mile N.E. of the village of Cudham. The farm has been in existence for 300 years and occupies an area of 292 acres. The old farm house fell down and the present building was erected in the 1920's. There is only one full-time employee with extra help being brought in from other farms when needed. The farm grows WHEAT,(sold to local flour mills), BARLEY,(exported to the Soviet Union), OIL-SEED RAPE,(sold to corn merchants for use in margarine and cooking oils), and BEANS and SILAGE,(used for cattle feed). The milking herd was sold in 1980 and now only beef cattle are reared, 50 Charolais-cross cattle are bought in at 9 months of age and sold as 2 year olds at Haywards Heath Market. The farm has been owned by the same family since 1934.
